reference.title: Rule 1: Form the possessive singular of nouns by adding 's
reference.shortdesc: Form the possessive singular of nouns by adding 's.

section.p: Follow this rule whatever the final consonant. Thus write,
section.pre: Charles's friend Burns's poems the witch's malice
section.p: This is the usage of the United States Government Printing Office and of the Oxford University Press.

Exceptions are the possessive of ancient proper names in -es and -is, the possessive Jesus', and such forms as for conscience' sake, for righteousness' sake. But such forms as Achilles' heel, Moses' laws, Isis' temple are commonly replaced by
section.pre: the heel of Achilles the laws of Moses the temple of Isis
section.p: The pronominal possessives hers, its, theirs, yours, and oneself have no apostrophe.
